intro: Pseudolysimachion subsessile, commonly known as the narrowleaf pseudolysimachion, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, compound leaves with a distinctive pinnate structure. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, arranged in umbels, and bloom in early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
